page.title: 18Mr.Bell-Memories of an OAP 2
page.content: {CONT from page 17 Mr.Bell remembers the soup kitchens where poor people were sure of something to eat. The Silver Jubilee was celebrated in his street with a party.There was lots of food.The children were dressed in red,white and blue clothes specially made for the occasion by their mothers.After tea the children took part in organised games. A lot of things have changed since 1935.Some things are better but Mr.Bell hinks that today there is a lack of community spirit- n o longer can you go out and leave your door unlocked without worrying about someone unwelcome going in.
